stomach-ache.name: Stomach Ache

home_remedies.title: Ginger Tea
home_remedies.description: Ginger is known for its anti-inflammatory properties. Sip on warm ginger tea to help soothe an upset stomach.

home_remedies.title: BRAT Diet
home_remedies.description: Stick to simple foods like Bananas, Rice, Applesauce, and Toast. These are easy to digest and can help bind stool.

home_remedies.title: Peppermint
home_remedies.description: Peppermint can help relax stomach muscles. Peppermint tea or even smelling peppermint oil can provide relief.

stomach-ache.common_medicines: Antacids like Digene, Gelusil. Consult a doctor if pain persists.

headache.name: Headache

home_remedies.title: Stay Hydrated
home_remedies.description: Dehydration is a common cause of headaches. Drink a full glass of water slowly.

home_remedies.title: Cold Compress
home_remedies.description: Applying a cold compress or ice pack to the forehead or back of the neck can help numb the area and shrink blood vessels.

home_remedies.title: Rest in a Dark Room
home_remedies.description: Sensitivity to light and sound can worsen headaches. Rest in a quiet, dark room to reduce stimulation.

headache.common_medicines: Paracetamol (Crocin), Ibuprofen (Brufen). Consult a doctor for recurring headaches.

joint-pain.name: Joint Pain

home_remedies.title: Hot and Cold Packs
home_remedies.description: Use a hot pack to relax muscles and a cold pack to reduce inflammation and swelling. Alternate between them.

home_remedies.title: Turmeric Milk (Haldi Doodh)
home_remedies.description: Turmeric contains curcumin, a powerful anti-inflammatory compound. Drink a glass of warm milk with a teaspoon of turmeric.

home_remedies.title: Gentle Stretching
home_remedies.description: Light and gentle stretching can improve flexibility and reduce stiffness in the joints. Avoid any painful movements.

joint-pain.common_medicines: Pain relief gels (Volini), Diclofenac. Always consult a doctor for chronic joint pain.

cold-cough.name: Cold & Cough

home_remedies.title: Honey and Lemon Tea
home_remedies.description: A warm mixture of honey and lemon in water can soothe a sore throat and suppress a cough.

home_remedies.title: Steam Inhalation
home_remedies.description: Inhaling steam from a bowl of hot water can help clear nasal congestion and soothe irritated airways.

home_remedies.title: Gargle with Salt Water
home_remedies.description: Gargling with warm salt water can reduce throat swelling and irritation.

cold-cough.common_medicines: Cough syrups (Benadryl), Lozenges (Vicks). See a doctor if symptoms last more than a week.

sleeplessness.name: Sleeplessness

home_remedies.title: Warm Milk
home_remedies.description: A glass of warm milk before bed can be calming and help promote sleep.

home_remedies.title: Establish a Routine
home_remedies.description: Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends, to regulate your body's internal clock.

home_remedies.title: Avoid Screens Before Bed
home_remedies.description: The blue light from phones, TVs, and computers can interfere with sleep. Turn them off an hour before bedtime.

sleeplessness.common_medicines: Melatonin supplements. It's best to consult a doctor before taking any sleep aids.

indigestion-gas.name: Indigestion & Gas

home_remedies.title: Fennel Seeds (Saunf)
home_remedies.description: Chewing a teaspoon of fennel seeds after a meal can aid digestion and reduce gas.

home_remedies.title: Ajwain (Carom Seeds) Water
home_remedies.description: Boil a teaspoon of ajwain in water, strain, and drink. It provides quick relief from gas and indigestion.

home_remedies.title: Avoid Trigger Foods
home_remedies.description: Pay attention to foods that cause discomfort, such as very oily or spicy meals, and try to avoid them.

indigestion-gas.common_medicines: Antacids (Eno, Pudin Hara). If symptoms are frequent, consult a doctor.

fatigue.name: Fatigue / Low Energy

home_remedies.title: Stay Hydrated
home_remedies.description: Even mild dehydration can cause feelings of tiredness. Ensure you're drinking enough water throughout the day.

home_remedies.title: Nutrient-Rich Diet
home_remedies.description: Focus on a balanced diet with fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. Iron-rich foods like spinach can be particularly helpful.

home_remedies.title: Short Walk
home_remedies.description: A brief, 10-15 minute walk can boost circulation and increase energy levels more effectively than a nap sometimes.

fatigue.common_medicines: Vitamin supplements (B12, D) may help, but only after consulting a doctor to check for deficiencies.

skin-irritation.name: Minor Skin Irritation

home_remedies.title: Coconut Oil
home_remedies.description: Applying a thin layer of coconut oil can moisturize dry skin and soothe mild irritation due to its natural properties.

home_remedies.title: Oatmeal Bath
home_remedies.description: Soaking in a lukewarm bath with finely ground oatmeal can relieve itching and calm irritated skin.

home_remedies.title: Cool Compress
home_remedies.description: Applying a cool, damp cloth to the affected area can help reduce itching, redness, and swelling.

skin-irritation.common_medicines: Calamine lotion (Lacto Calamine), Antihistamine creams. See a doctor if the rash is severe or spreads.
